caption:
b'We\xe2\x80\x99ve welcomed nearly 1,000 new Atlassians since working remotely and unprecedented times call for even more teamwork. Although we\xe2\x80\x99re apart, we\xe2\x80\x99re all in this together! \xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Interested in joining the team? Check the link in our bio to learn more.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
#AtlassianWorkLife #LifeAtAtlassian #Teamwork #RemoteWork'

b'We were curious to hear what our company values meant to this summer\xe2\x80\x99s interns. \xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3Last but not least, Max shared their take on the Atlassian value "Don\xe2\x80\x99t #@!% the customer":
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m a computer science major, but I was really hesitant to enter the software industry. My conception of tech companies are organizations that prioritize profit over people, and I didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to have anything to do with that. That\xe2\x80\x99s why it was such a breath of fresh air to discover Atlassian. Their value of \xe2\x80\x98Don\xe2\x80\x99t #@!% the customer\xe2\x80\x99 resonates with me, and even more than that, the commitment to this value is more than surface deep. Our goal is to help people. During my time here, I\xe2\x80\x99ve been heartened to see people living this value. It means taking extra time on the developer\xe2\x80\x99s end to make sure that users have a good experience. It means listening to customer feedback and actually making changes because of it. It means learning from our mistakes and admitting when we\xe2\x80\x99re wrong, so that we can fix things and make them better. \xe2\x80\x98Don\xe2\x80\x99t #@!% the customer\xe2\x80\x99 means that at the end of the day, I can be proud of the work we do here at Atlassian, because we are helping unleash the potential of every team\xe2\x80\x94without the huge caveats that I\xe2\x80\x99ve learned to expect from Silicon Valley.\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
- Max Sutton\xe2\x81\xa3
@maxter326
\xe2\x81\xa3
#CompanyCulture #CompanyValues #CoreValues #AtlassianValues #Teamwork #Internship #InternshipProgram'

b'How do you interpret \xe2\x80\x9cBuild with heart and balance\xe2\x80\x9d? We asked a few of this summer\xe2\x80\x99s interns for their take on the Atlassian company value that resonates with them the most.\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x80\x9cI really admire people who are able to step back and focus on the bigger picture. To me, that is really what \xe2\x80\x98Build with heart and balance\xe2\x80\x99 is all about. At Atlassian, I\xe2\x80\x99ve really loved seeing how my fellow Atlassians truly care about that big picture impact, while still getting things done. From trying to find that sweet spot between perfection and delivery on technical solutions to making sure your fellow coworkers are maintaining a work-life balance, I\xe2\x80\x99ve seen how \xe2\x80\x98Build with heart and balance\xe2\x80\x99 really impacts how Atlassian works.\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3
- Isabel Allen\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3
@isabelllllllly\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
#BuildWithHeartAndBalance #CompanyCulture #CompanyValues #CoreValues #AtlassianValues #Teamwork #Internship #InternshipProgram'

b'When you hear \xe2\x80\x9cPlay, as a team\xe2\x80\x9d what does it mean to you? We asked a few of this summer\xe2\x80\x99s interns for their take on the Atlassian company value that resonates with them the most. \xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x80\x9cFrom working at Atlassian, I have learned what it means to \xe2\x80\x98Play, as a team\xe2\x80\x99 both within and outside of the workplace. I have always believed that behind every great product is a great team, and my colleagues here embody this value every day. At Atlassian, there are endless opportunities to share our unique ideas; more importantly, we collectively strive to maintain a safe space where all voices are not only welcomed, but encouraged. In this pursuit, my team members and I proactively make time to get to know each other outside of regular meetings and make ourselves available to anyone in need of an extra hand. I truly feel connected to this value, as it has transcended the barriers created by remote work this year. To me, \xe2\x80\x98Play, as a team\xe2\x80\x99 means to constantly strive to create an open community for everyone to excel together as a whole. As I continue to grow personally and professionally, I plan to continue to practice and share this value with everyone around me.\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3
- Jerry Qing\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3
@jerdeqing
\xe2\x81\xa3
#PlayAsATeam #CompanyCulture #CompanyValues #CoreValues #AtlassianValues #Teamwork #Internship #InternshipProgram'

b'What does \xe2\x80\x9cBe the change you seek\xe2\x80\x9d mean to you? We asked a few of this summer\xe2\x80\x99s interns for their take on the Atlassian company value that resonates with them the most. \xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x80\x9cThis summer, I learned that \xe2\x80\x98Be the change you seek\xe2\x80\x99 isn\xe2\x80\x99t just a phrase you find at the end of presentations. Rather, it\xe2\x80\x99s a shared mindset that\xe2\x80\x99s deeply embedded into the company culture and put into practice every single day. At their cores, Atlassians are passionate, resourceful individuals. They have their minds open to new possibilities, allow their actions to be reflections of their beliefs, and lead with heart to spark positive, lasting change. This collective sense of ownership and dedication to continuous improvement is something I\xe2\x80\x99ve never seen at another company, and a value I\xe2\x80\x99ll continue to instill in my personal and professional lives moving forward.\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
- Rachel Tang \xe2\x81\xa3
@_tangrachel
\xe2\x81\xa3
#BeTheChangeYouSeek #CompanyCulture #CompanyValues #CoreValues #AtlassianValues #Teamwork #Internship #InternshipProgram'

b'What are your company\xe2\x80\x99s values and what do they mean to you? The Atlassian company values guide what we do, why we create, and who we hire. We asked a few of this summer\xe2\x80\x99s interns for their take on the Atlassian value that resonates with them the most. \xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\x98Open company, no bullshit\xe2\x80\x99 is more than just a fun way to justify your overly candid responses in meetings, it\xe2\x80\x99s a mentality with which you approach your role in the company. Open company means that Atlassian is a space where you\xe2\x80\x99re meant to feel comfortable putting your ideas out there. If you have a vision, share it. If you have a question, ask it. No bullshit, on the other hand, is all about making sure you are bringing your whole, honest self to the table. If you don\xe2\x80\x99t understand something, don\xe2\x80\x99t be embarrassed to ask for help. If you think something needs to change, say it with your chest.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Together, \xe2\x80\x98Open company, no bullshit\xe2\x80\x99 means saying what needs to be said. It means saying the awkward part aloud and being honest about where the work needs to be done for the better of the TEAM.\xe2\x81\xa3"
\xe2\x81\xa3
- Khalid Ahmad
\xe2\x81\xa3
#CompanyCulture #CompanyValues #CoreValues #AtlassianValues #Teamwork #Internship #InternshipProgram'

b'Happy #NationalInternDay! This summer, Atlassian\xe2\x80\x99s Campus Recruiting Team welcomed 71 incredible interns from all over the U.S. to join our internship program. This was the first time the 12-week program went completely virtual! Before starting, our interns were assigned to various teams around the company and were given the opportunity to work on projects that align with both their interests, and the business\xe2\x80\x99 needs. From enhancing Atlassian\xe2\x80\x99s support platform to assisting the Workplace Productivity Team in planning a smooth transition back into the office, our interns have been able to work hands on with new technologies and the latest software developments. They\xe2\x80\x99ve also had the opportunity to hear from other inspiring Atlassian teams and leaders, gain insight into our culture and values, and build personal relationships amongst each other while attending some fun virtual social events (paint night is pictured here!). We\xe2\x80\x99re so thankful to have our interns this summer and have already seen the tremendous value they\xe2\x80\x99ve provided Atlassian.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Learn more about our internship program at atlassian.com/company/careers/interns, and be on the lookout over the next few weeks for stories from some of our current interns!\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
#SummerInternship #Internship #InternshipProgram #Recruiting'

b'That\xe2\x80\x99s a wrap!:headphone: Don\xe2\x80\x99t miss our final Teamistry episode of the season highlighting the unlikely team behind the creation of Neil Armstrong\xe2\x80\x99s moonsuit (and how a single bad stitch meant certain death for astronauts!). \xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Head to the link in our bio to tune in and catch up on the other episodes from season 1. And be on the lookout for season 2... coming in September!:eyes:
\xe2\x81\xa3
#Podcast #NewPodcast #Teamwork #Collaboration #Teamistry #UnsungHeroes #NeilArmstrong #SpaceFlight #ManOnTheMoon'

b'@translawcenter is the largest national trans-led organization advocating self-determination for all people.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Grounded in legal expertise and committed to racial justice, TLC employs a variety of community-driven strategies to keep transgender and gender nonconforming people alive, thriving, and fighting for liberation.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Click the link in our bio to learn more about @translawcenter, and how we will match donations made to our featured organizations this week up to $150,000.00\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
#BlackLivesMatter #BlackTransLivesMatter\xe2\x81\xa3 #Pride #Pride2020'

b'Marsha P. Johnson was an activist, self-identified drag queen, performer, and survivor. She was a prominent figure in the Stonewall uprising of 1969. Marsha went by \xe2\x80\x9cBlack Marsha\xe2\x80\x9d before settling on Marsha P. Johnson. The \xe2\x80\x9cP\xe2\x80\x9d stood for \xe2\x80\x9cPay It No Mind,\xe2\x80\x9d which is what Marsha would say in response to questions about her gender.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
@mpjinstitute protects and defends the human rights of Black transgender people by organizing, advocating, creating an intentional community to heal, developing transformative leadership, and promoting their collective power.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Click the link in our bio to learn more about @mpjinstitute, and how we will match donations made to our featured organizations this week up to $150,000.00\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
#BlackLivesMatter #BlackTransLivesMatter\xe2\x81\xa3 #Pride #Pride2020'

b'As the global leader of the Black LGBTQIA+ Pride movement, @ctr4blackequity is breaking barriers to accessing employment and opportunity through equipping community leaders with the tools, experiences, and knowledge that enable them to unlock the leadership and problem-solving potential of themselves and others.

Click the link in our bio to learn more about the Center for Black Equity, and how we will match donations made to our featured organizations this week up to $150,000.00

#BlackLivesMatter #Pride #Pride2020'

b'LGBTQIA+ individuals are three times more likely to be jailed. At risk of abuse, many can\xe2\x80\x99t afford bail. \xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
The LGBTQ Freedom Fund posts bail to secure the safety and liberty of individuals in U.S. jails and immigration facilities, with a focus on the LGBTQIA+ community.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Click the link in our bio to learn more about the LGBTQ Freedom Fund, and how we will match donations made to our featured organizations this week up to $150,000.00\xe2\x81\xa3.
\xe2\x81\xa3
#BlackLivesMatter\xe2\x81\xa3 #Pride #Pride2020'

b'@transjusticefp provides grants to trans-led groups and initiatives working to fight racism, economic injustice, transmisogyny, ableism, immigration, incarceration, and other intersecting oppressions affecting trans people. In the last 7 years, they\xe2\x80\x99ve given away 903+ grants worth $2.7+ million dollars.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Black trans communities are often left out or erased from conversations about state-sanctioned violence against Black people. Atlassian wants to amplify trans justice groups that need collective support today, and we\xe2\x80\x99re proud to spotlight them this week.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Click the link in our bio to learn more about @transjusticefp, and how we will match donations made to our featured organizations this week up to $150,000.00\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
#blacklivesmatter #blacktranslivesmatter\xe2\x81\xa3 #pride #Pride2020'

b'Pride has always been about carrying on the legacy of celebration, protest, and intersectionality. Atlassian pledges to continue taking a stance and to use our platform and capital to support the Black LGBTQ+ community. \xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
The first Pride march was held on June 28, 1970, on the one-year anniversary of the Stonewall Uprising, which was organized and led by the Black and Latinx trans community. This moment and movement serves as a reminder there\xe2\x80\x99s a lot of work left to do. And before we Play as a team, we must fight as a team, for and alongside the marginalized, for justice, equality, and equity. \xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Join our global fundraiser this week supporting 5 nonprofits that represent and fight for marginalized identities of the LGBTQAI+ community. Atlassian will be matching donations up to $150,000, and splitting the total amount equally. We\xe2\x80\x99re inviting our customers, partners, users, followers, and our broader community to stand up as allies and support.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Keep an eye out for a featured organization each day, and click the link in our bio to learn more and get your donations matched.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
#Pride #PrideMonth #Pride2020\xe2\x81\xa3'

b'We believe different perspectives are valuable because they\xe2\x80\x99re different, and open work means being open to all.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3

\xe2\x81\xa3
#InternationalWomensDay'

b'We aim to celebrate women every day, but we\xe2\x80\x99re taking today to give special recognition to womxn at Atlassian who continue to inspire and lead. :flexed_biceps:\n\xe2\x81\xa3\nFor #InternationalWomensDay, we asked Atlassians to nominate and recognize amazing womxn at Atlassian who inspire them, challenge them, and truly represent Atlassian values. :sparkles:'

b'With the health and safety of Atlassians, our partners, and customers as our highest priority, we\xe2\x80\x99ve made the difficult decision to cancel Atlassian Summit 2020 and take the experience online with the Atlassian Remote Summit. Learn more by clicking the link in our bio.'

b'"I can wear what I want. I can have rainbows on my computer, and I can talk openly about being married to a woman. Everyone on my team knows I\xe2\x80\x99m gay and that\xe2\x80\x99s totally fine. It's not something I have to monitor or be strange about. I don't have to censor myself. I\xe2\x80\x99m just me." \xe2\x81\xa3
- Noni Hollonds\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
"Just because something\xe2\x80\x99s scary, doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean you shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t do something.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
I didn\xe2\x80\x99t always bring my entire self to work, and struggled with confidence. But it\xe2\x80\x99s important to be kind to yourself and get out of your comfort zone."\xe2\x81\xa3
- Neil Jahans\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
"Every day, I can come to work and be safe and accepted as part of the LBGTIQ community. I\xe2\x80\x99m out to all of my co-workers and don\xe2\x80\x99t hide it proudly wearing my rainbow socks! I\xe2\x80\x99ve spoken to team leads openly about LBGTIQ causes and why I want to dedicate 20% of my time to them, and they\xe2\x80\x99re all totally supportive. Atlassian makes me feel like I can be my true self at work everyday."\xe2\x81\xa3
- Peter Cowan\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
"Growing up in a small village in Slovakia had its challenges. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t until I moved to Sydney and started working at Atlassian that I came out and truly felt accepted for who I am. At work, I have zero fear when it comes to talking about myself or my sexuality and it feels good to work for a company who you feel supported by." \xe2\x81\xa3
- Tom Belica\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3 \xe2\x81\xa3
#SydneyMardiGras #MardiGras2020 #WhatMatters'

b'"I believe corporations need to have more of a social stance on issues. Seeing how vocal Mike and Scott personally and Atlassian as a company were around marriage equality was a big reason for why I wanted to work here. If you\xe2\x80\x99re gonna talk the talk, you have to walk the walk."\xe2\x81\xa3
- Will Jenkins, @williamo \xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
"People question my sexuality all the time. I feel like I\xe2\x80\x99ve come out so many times and it can be exhausting. For many bi people, it can feel like a constant need to prove myself or explain my preference. For me, the lack of awareness or visibility of what it means to be bi-sexual that I've faced has constantly made me question myself.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
When I came into Atlassian for my interview, the office was being set up for Mardi Gras. I remember texting my friends saying, 'There's giant rainbow balloons, there's glitter, and there's all these rainbows and flags.' I remember thinking, 'I really want to be here.' Having joined, that acceptance has only continued. I don't need to justify myself, I don't need to explain it, I don't need to keep coming out. I just need to be me, and nobody bats an eyelid."\xe2\x81\xa3
- Rachel Crossman, @thecrossette \xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
"People should actively think about how to create a space where people feel open, because all the labor generally falls on the person who is not part of the status quo. It comes down to paying attention, seeing past your own privilege. An inclusive workspace is not to benefit a minority of people\xe2\x80\x94it\xe2\x80\x99s to benefit everyone as an equal."\xe2\x81\xa3
- Michael Belton, @mykale37\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
#SydneyMardiGras #MardiGras2020 #WhatMatters'

b'"I think it\xe2\x80\x99s important for companies to visibly demonstrate what they believe in and what they stand for. During my first interview with Atlassian, the interviewer had a pride sticker on their laptop that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t necessarily a personal statement, but rather a non-verbal statement of support and that made an impression.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Companies like Atlassian stand for fairness and openness and that gives me confidence that inclusivity will prevail. If we don\xe2\x80\x99t demonstrate our values and take a stand together, the oppressors win as the only voice in the room."\xe2\x81\xa3
- Siri Kommedahl, @siri.kommedahl
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
"It's important to be openly different because it opens the door for future generations. For so many years, I went out of my way to keep to myself, but after joining Atlassian, I\xe2\x80\x99ve realised I can be who I am with everyone. Every day I\xe2\x80\x99m exposed to different types of people and I cherish that. By being our genuine selves, we understand both others and ourselves more deeply, and encourage others to do the same."\xe2\x81\xa3
- Peter Grasevski, @pdgee \xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
"If I could go back in time and tell myself something, it would be that I don't have to base who I am on what others would or wouldn't ridicule me about, and that there are people out there who accept the core of who I am, I just had to find them." \xe2\x81\xa3
- Avi Knoll\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
#SydneyMardiGras #MardiGras2020 #WhatMatters'

b'"It's funny, because 17-year-old me, on some level, knew that I was trans, but didn't have the words for it. I didn't have role models to connect to, beyond guests on Jerry Springer or dead bodies on Law and Order. When I came out, I was, for almost everyone that I knew, the first out trans person they met.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
I've been at Atlassian over a decade now. I transitioned while I worked here and shared a very candid blog post announcing it. I shared my story with everyone at Atlassian because I didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to have 10,000 awkward conversations, but more importantly, because I felt empowered to do so. I didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to constantly be hiding or feeling uncomfortable, and I was greeted by an outpouring of support almost instantly."\xe2\x81\xa3
- Kara Hatherly, @karahatherly\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
"For a long time, being \xe2\x80\x9cprofessional\xe2\x80\x9d meant hiding who you are\xe2\x80\x94not saying you\xe2\x80\x99re LGBTQ, not mentioning your husband or wife, or anything about your family.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
The day I walked into Martin Place to interview for Atlassian and saw rainbow flags, it was powerful. It said there\xe2\x80\x99s a community of queer people who are supportive and open here, and gave me hope." \xe2\x81\xa3
- Linette Voller, @mslanei\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
"On the day the marriage equality results were coming out, I remember people turning on the TVs at lunch and sitting with a huge group of queer people and allies. When it was announced it was a yes vote, the feeling in that room was so powerful. I burst into tears, and people around me were crying and just overjoyed. It\xe2\x80\x99s amazing we could be so openly emotional and vulnerable. I\xe2\x80\x99ll never forget that moment at Atlassian." \xe2\x81\xa3
- Daniel Kostrzynski, @deaxlin\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
#SydneyMardiGras #MardiGras2020 #WhatMatters'

b'"No matter how meticulously you plan, there\xe2\x80\x99s gonna be a curveball, so you shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t get too attached to the current state of things." - @ashleyfaus, Senior Manager of Integrated Media at Atlassian\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Ashley took a winding path into tech, going from a solar start-up to aviation to a communication agency and finally, two security start-ups. She found elements to love in each industry, but the driving force was always bringing her unique skillset and expertise to the team. Ashley believes her willingness and ability to learn new industries, terms, and products has helped her be a better marketer.\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
We asked Ashley to share with us the best career advice she's ever received and she had a hard time choosing just one piece of advice! Here were her top three:\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
1) Always put your hand up\xe2\x81\xa3
2) Be ready to take the opportunity when it arises\xe2\x81\xa3
3) Know the price of your soul\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
